issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

fields.description:
Configure node label and load scheduler Page
On each reload of the page the below exception gets thrown in logs

fields.summary: Exception on RM scheduler page loading with labels

comments.body:
This issue is happening when the node-labels is enabled, one of the tag is not closed properly.
Submitting the patch for the same.

This message was automatically generated.

UT Failure are unrelated to current patch.
UT addition/modification not required only small UI change.
Committed to trunk/branch-2. thanks [~mohdshahidkhan] for the patch!!

FAILURE: Integrated in Hadoop-trunk-Commit #9017 (See [https://builds.apache.org/job/Hadoop-trunk-Commit/9017/])
YARN-4109. Exception on RM scheduler page loading with labels. (Mohammad (rohithsharmaks: rev 8c180a13c82ab9d60f595e6942e35d51024dab53)
* hadoop-yarn-project/hadoop-yarn/hadoop-yarn-server/hadoop-yarn-server-resourcemanager/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/yarn/server/resourcemanager/webapp/CapacitySchedulerPage.java
* hadoop-yarn-project/CHANGES.txt

Hi [~rohithsharma]/[~mohdshahidkhan]
Do you think is better to add this to branch-2.8?
+1. Yes this will be helpful in 2.8 release.
[~rohithsharma], seems this is not yet in branch-2.8. should we get it in ?
Yes correct. This can be back backported to 2.8. [~mohdshahidkhan] / [~rohithsharma], could you pls share a patch.
Apologies for missing earlier comments. Let me back port this to branch-2.8
Back ported to branch-2.8!! And changed the fix version/s as to 2.8.

I think we need to take this for branch-2.7 also. [~vinodkv], I noticed that this error is shown in log in the 2.7.3 release.

Since this is not critical, i feel we can move to 2.7.4. [~vinodkv] and [~rohithsharma] sounds good?
I do not see any functional impact from this other than an exception in RM logs.  I think this can be moved to 2.7.4 given other folks are also fine.
[~shv] this applies cleanly to branch-2.7. Can we backport it there? Thanks!
